infos.text: They comprise the top layers of stratified (many layers) non-keratinized squamous epithelium.
Non-keratinizing squamous epithelium lines labia minora, vagina and ectocervix.
These cells are in layers to provide a protective function.
These cells are mature squamous cells that are not capable of any metabolic activity and are prone to exfoliation.

The squamous epithelium will mature all the way upto superficial cell layers under the hormonal influence of female sex hormone, estrogen, secreted in the first half of the menstrual cycle by the ovary in cycling women.
